summary: This is a November 9, 2021 letter from the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York to defense counsel in the Ghislaine Maxwell case, transmitting a production of business records from Southern District of Florida files. The letter explains the materials are marked as subject to specific paragraphs of the protective order and are largely duplicative of previously produced discovery.

events.title: Production of Discovery Materials
events.description: The U.S. Attorney's Office for the SDNY produces business records from SDFL files to Ghislaine Maxwell's defense counsel, marked as subject to a protective order.

events.title: Protective Order Issued
events.description: A protective order was issued in the Ghislaine Maxwell case, governing the handling of confidential discovery materials.

events.title: Prior Discovery Production
events.description: The government had previously produced materials from the Florida FBI file to the defense in the fall of 2020.

keyFacts: The U.S. Attorney's Office produced business records from Southern District of Florida files to Ghislaine Maxwell's defense team on November 9, 2021.
The materials were marked as 'SUBJECT TO PROTECTIVE ORDER' referencing specific paragraphs from the July 31, 2020 order, due to a DOJ directive to avoid confusion with classified document markings.
The government stated these materials were largely duplicative of records previously produced from the Florida FBI file in the fall of 2020.
The letter confirms the government's ongoing discovery obligations in the case United States v. Ghislaine Maxwell (20 Cr. 330).
